planets.name: Sun
planets.description: The Sun is the star at the center of our solar system, providing the light and heat that sustains life on Earth. It's a massive ball of hot, ionized gas.

planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System. It's a rocky world with extreme temperature variations due to its lack of atmosphere.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is Earth's closest planetary neighbor, but its thick atmosphere traps heat, making it the hottest planet in our solar system. It rotates very slowly.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the only known planet to support life, with a diverse ecosystem and a protective atmosphere. It's unique for having liquid water on its surface.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars is a cold, desert world with a thin atmosphere. It's known for its reddish appearance and is a target for future human exploration due to evidence of past liquid water.

planets.name: Jupiter

details.Moons: Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto, and many more

planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, a gas giant with a powerful magnetic field and numerous moons. It's famous for its Great Red Spot, a massive storm.

planets.name: Saturn

details.Moons: Titan, Rhea, Iapetus, Dione, Tethys, and many more

planets.description: Saturn is known for its spectacular ring system, made up of ice and rock particles. It's another gas giant with a large family of moons, including Titan, which has a thick atmosphere.

planets.name: Uranus

details.Moons: Miranda, Ariel, Umbriel, Titania, Oberon, and many more

planets.description: Uranus is an ice giant with a unique sideways tilt, causing extreme seasonal variations. It has a faint ring system and numerous moons. It has a blue colour due to methane in its atmosphere.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the farthest major planet from the Sun, an ice giant with strong winds and a vibrant blue color. It has a dynamic atmosphere and several moons, including Triton.
